results.csv_string_response: The table below presents a description of the inputs to fair value valuation methods that are relevant for the Group’s financial instruments carried at fair value as at 31 December 2019.
results.json_rows_response:
1. The fair value of financial instruments that are not traded in an active market is determined by using valuation techniques. The fair value of financial instruments that are not traded in an active market is determined by using valuation techniques that maximise the use of observable market data where it is available and rely as little as possible on entity specific estimates. If all significant inputs required for evaluating the fair value of a financial instrument are observable, the instrument is included in level 2.
If one or more of the significant inputs are not based on observable market data, the instrument is included in level 3.
2. The following inputs are not based on observable market data:
• Dealer quotes for similar instruments;
• The fair value of interest rate swaps is calculated as the present value of the estimated future cash flows based on observable yield curves; and
• Other techniques, such as discounted cash flow analysis, are used to determine fair value for financial instruments.

results.question: What is the definition of deferred revenues?
gold_answer: Performance obligations for which payments have been received by the customer prior to revenue recognition.
results.markdown_table_response: Deferred revenue is a performance obligation that has been incurred by a customer before the date revenue is recognized. Deferred revenue is a portion of revenue recognized in a period when it is not available for recognition. The performance obligation is not the same as the cost of goods sold. The performance obligation is not available for use in cost allocation or any other calculation.
results.csv_string_response: Deferred revenue is defined as the performance obligations for which payments have been received prior to revenue recognition. For example, the customer has agreed to pay for upgrades that will be completed over the next twelve months, but has not yet received the upgrades. The customer has agreed to pay for the software upgrades that are already installed, but has not yet received the software upgrades. Deferred revenue has also included amounts allocated to mobile dashboard and on-line apps and unspecified upgrade rights. Deferred revenue also includes deferred subscription-based services.
results.json_rows_response: Deferred revenue is the difference between the amount of deferred revenue (net of the impact of the deferred amounts) and the amount of revenue (net of the impact of the deferred amounts) that has been recognized by the business.
